alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 1:10PM MST until July 06 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Red Flag Warnings Issued For Thursday and Friday This Week... Increasing windy conditions Thursday will persist into Friday. This wind, combined with single digits RHs in the afternoons will promote rapid fire spread. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Thursday. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Dilkon, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Fredonia, Ganado, Grand Canyon, Holbrook, Jacob Lake, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, North Rim, Page, Shonto, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City, Valle, Williams, Window Rock and Winslow. This includes portions of the Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest and Prescott National Forest. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.
